spellcasting.name: Constant Effects
headerEntries: The mage is always under the effect of one of the following spells, requiring no concentration. At the start of its turn the mage can change which spell affects him or reactivate it if it was dispelled (no action required).

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mage is a 20th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 21} , {@hit 13} to hit with spell attacks). The mage has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Transmuter's Stone
entries: Once a day the mage can use its action to consume the energy reserves of his transmuter's stone to create one of the following effects:
{@b Panacea} The mage remove all curses, diseases, and poisons affecting a creature that it touches with the transmuter's stone. The creature also regains all its hit points.
{@b Restore Life} The mage can cast {@spell raise dead} spell on a creature it touches with the transmuter's stone, without expending a spell slot or having the spell prepared.

{@b Restore Youth} The mage touches a willing creature with the stone, and that creature's apparent age is reduced by {@dice 3d10} years, to a minimum of 13 years. This effect doesn't extend the creature's lifespan.

trait.name: Master of Transmutation
entries: The mage can't be affected by spells the school of transmutation unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.
Additionaly any spell of 2nd level or lower from the transmutation school cast by the mage do not require concentration and has its duration increased to 1 hour (if not already).

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the mage fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

bonus.name: Enhanced Support
entries: Whenever the mage casts {@spell polymorph}, {@spell mass polymorph|XGE} or {@spell true polymorph}, {@spell animate objects} it can affect the target with a 1st or 2nd level spell as a bonus action.

reaction.name: Elemental Rebuke
entries: When the mage is hit by an attack it can use its reaction to cast a Investiture Spell, requiring no concentration. The spell lasts until the start of his next turn.
{@spell Investiture of flame|XGE}
{@spell Investiture of ice|XGE}
{@spell Investiture of stone|XGE}
{@spell Investiture of wind|XGE}

legendary.name: Higher Casting(2)
entries: The mage casts a spell.

legendary.name: Lesser Casting
entries: The mage casts a spell of 3rd level or lower.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The mage move up to its speed.

legendary.name: Use item
entries: The mage uses an item.

trait.name: Axiomatic Mind
entries: The duodrone can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

trait.name: Disintegration
entries: If the duodrone dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind its weapons and anything else it was carrying.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The duodrone makes two fist attacks or two javelin attacks.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

variant.name: Rogue Modrons
entries: A modron unit sometimes becomes defective, either through natural decay or exposure to chaotic forces. Rogue modrons don't act in accordance with Primus's wishes and directives, breaking laws, disobeying orders, and even engaging in violence. Other modrons hunt down such rogues.
A rogue modron loses the Axiomatic Mind trait and can have any alignment other than lawful neutral. Otherwise, it has the same statistics as a regular modron of its rank.
The blocky duodrones supervise units of monodrones and can perform up to two tasks at a time.

entries.name: Modrons
entries: Modrons are beings of absolute law that adhere to a hive-like hierarchy. They inhabit the plane of Mechanus and tend its eternally revolving gears, their existence a clockwork routine of perfect order.

entries.name: Absolute Law and Order
entries: Under the direction of their leader, Primus, modrons increase order in the multiverse in accordance with laws beyond the comprehension of mortal minds. Their own minds are networked in a hierarchal pyramid, in which each modron receives commands from superiors and delegates orders to underlings. A modron carries out commands with total obedience, utmost efficiency, and an absence of morality or ego. Modrons have no sense of self beyond what is necessary to fulfill their duties. They exist as a unified collective, divided by ranks, yet they always refer to themselves collectively. To a modron, there is no "I," but only "we" or "us."
Variant: Rogue Modrons

A modron unit sometimes becomes defective, either through natural decay or exposure to chaotic forces. Rogue modrons don't act in accordance with Primus's wishes and directives, breaking laws, disobeying orders, and even engaging in violence. Other modrons hunt down such rogues.
A rogue modron loses the Axiomatic Mind trait and can have any alignment other than lawful neutral. Otherwise, it has the same statistics as a regular modron of its rank.

entries.name: Absolute Hierarchy
entries: Modrons communicate only with their own rank and the ranks immediately above and below them. Modrons more than one rank away are either too advanced or too simple to understand.

entries.name: Cogs of the Great Machine
entries: If a modron is destroyed, its remains disintegrate. A replacement from the next lowest rank then transforms in a flash of light, gaining the physical form of its new rank. The promoted modron is replaced by one of its underlings in the same manner, all the way to the lowest levels of the hierarchy. There, a new modron is created by Primus, with a steady stream of monodrones leaving the Great Modron Cathedral on Mechanus as a result.

entries.name: The Great Modron March
entries: When the gears of Mechanus complete seventeen cycles once every 289 years, Primus sends a vast army of modrons across the Outer Planes, ostensibly on a reconnaissance mission. The march is long and dangerous, and only a small number of modrons returns to Mechanus.

trait.name: Axiomatic Mind
entries: The monodrone can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

trait.name: Disintegration
entries: If the monodrone dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind its weapons and anything else it was carrying.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Excavate {@recharge 6}
entries: A thin blue ray springs from the monodrone eyes toward a creature within 10 feet. A creature targeted by this ray must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 10d6 + 40} force damage.

trait.name: Axiomatic Mind
entries: The pentadrone can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

trait.name: Disintegration
entries: If the pentadrone dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind its weapons and anything else it was carrying.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pentadrone makes five arm attacks.

action.name: Arm
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Paralysis Gas {@recharge 5}
entries: The pentadrone exhales a 30-foot cone of gas. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

variant.name: Rogue Modrons
entries: A modron unit sometimes becomes defective, either through natural decay or exposure to chaotic forces. Rogue modrons don't act in accordance with Primus's wishes and directives, breaking laws, disobeying orders, and even engaging in violence. Other modrons hunt down such rogues.
A rogue modron loses the Axiomatic Mind trait and can have any alignment other than lawful neutral. Otherwise, it has the same statistics as a regular modron of its rank.
Pentadrones oversee Mechanus's worker populace and can improvise in response to new situations.

entries.name: Modrons
entries: Modrons are beings of absolute law that adhere to a hive-like hierarchy. They inhabit the plane of Mechanus and tend its eternally revolving gears, their existence a clockwork routine of perfect order.

entries.name: Absolute Law and Order
entries: Under the direction of their leader, Primus, modrons increase order in the multiverse in accordance with laws beyond the comprehension of mortal minds. Their own minds are networked in a hierarchal pyramid, in which each modron receives commands from superiors and delegates orders to underlings. A modron carries out commands with total obedience, utmost efficiency, and an absence of morality or ego. Modrons have no sense of self beyond what is necessary to fulfill their duties. They exist as a unified collective, divided by ranks, yet they always refer to themselves collectively. To a modron, there is no "I," but only "we" or "us."
Variant: Rogue Modrons

A modron unit sometimes becomes defective, either through natural decay or exposure to chaotic forces. Rogue modrons don't act in accordance with Primus's wishes and directives, breaking laws, disobeying orders, and even engaging in violence. Other modrons hunt down such rogues.
A rogue modron loses the Axiomatic Mind trait and can have any alignment other than lawful neutral. Otherwise, it has the same statistics as a regular modron of its rank.

entries.name: Absolute Hierarchy
entries: Modrons communicate only with their own rank and the ranks immediately above and below them. Modrons more than one rank away are either too advanced or too simple to understand.

entries.name: Cogs of the Great Machine
entries: If a modron is destroyed, its remains disintegrate. A replacement from the next lowest rank then transforms in a flash of light, gaining the physical form of its new rank. The promoted modron is replaced by one of its underlings in the same manner, all the way to the lowest levels of the hierarchy. There, a new modron is created by Primus, with a steady stream of monodrones leaving the Great Modron Cathedral on Mechanus as a result.

entries.name: The Great Modron March
entries: When the gears of Mechanus complete seventeen cycles once every 289 years, Primus sends a vast army of modrons across the Outer Planes, ostensibly on a reconnaissance mission. The march is long and dangerous, and only a small number of modrons returns to Mechanus.

trait.name: Rust Metal
entries: Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits the rust dragon corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits the rust dragon is destroyed after dealing damage.
The rust dragon can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical metal in 1 round.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rust dragon makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage plus ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage.

Additionally, if the creature is using a nonmagical metal armor or shield it takes a cumulative -1 penalty to the AC. If the armor is reduced below 10 AC or the shield drops to a bonus of +0 it is destroyed.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage plus {@damage 2d6} acid damage.

action.name: Rust Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The rust dragon exhales a corrosive acid in a 100-foot line. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking ({@damage 14d6}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Additionally, if the creature is using a nonmagical metal armor or shield it takes a cumulative -1 penalty to the AC. If the armor is reduced below 10 AC or the shield drops to a bonus of +0 it is destroyed.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the black ice golem moves at least 15 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with its tusks on the same turn, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d12} bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Transmuted
entries: The Golem is under the effect of the following spells:
{@spell expeditious retreat}
{@spell longstrider}
{@spell enhance ability} Bull's Strength
{@spell magic weapon}

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Running Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d12 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Secret Keeper
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The allip can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Maddening Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) psychic damage.

action.name: Whispers of Madness
entries: The allip chooses up to three creatures it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw, or it takes 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) psychic damage and must use its reaction to make a melee weapon attack against one creature of the allip's choice that the allip can see. Constructs and undead are immune to this effect.

action.name: Howling Babble {@recharge}
entries: Each creature within 30 feet of the allip that can hear it must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) psychic damage, and it is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned}. Constructs and undead are immune to this effect.

entries.name: Allip
entries: When a mind uncovers a secret that a powerful being has protected with a mighty curse, the result is often the emergence of an allip. Secrets protected in this manner range in scope from a demon lord's true name to the hidden truths of the cosmic order. The allip acquires the secret, but the curse annihilates its body and leaves behind a spectral creature composed of fragments from the victim's psyche and overwhelming psychic agony.

entries.name: Blasphemous Secrets
entries: Every allip is wracked with a horrifying insight that torments what remains of its mind. In the presence of other creatures, an allip seeks to relieve this burden by sharing its secret. The creature can impart only a shard of the knowledge that doomed it, but that piece is enough to wrack the recipient with temporary madness.

The survivors of an allip's attack are sometimes left with a compulsion to learn more about what spawned this monstrosity. Strange phrases echo through their minds, and weird visions occupy their dreams. The sense that some colossal truth sits just outside their recall plagues them for days, months, and sometimes years after their fateful encounter.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: An allip doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Insidious Lore
entries: An allip might attempt to share its lore to escape its curse and enter the afterlife. It can transfer knowledge from its mind by guiding another creature to write down what it knows. This process takes days or possibly weeks. An allip can accomplish this task by lurking in the study or workplace of a scholar. If the allip remains hidden, its victim is gradually overcome by manic energy. A scholar, driven by sudden insights to work night and day, produces reams of text with little memory of exactly what the documents contain. If the allip succeeds, it passes from the world—and its terrible secret hides somewhere in the scholar's text, waiting to be discovered by its next victim.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The follower is a 14th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). Zindar knows the following sorcerer spells:

trait.name: Dragon Wings
entries: As a bonus action on his turn, Zindar can sprout a pair of dragon wings from his back, gaining a flying speed of 30 feet until he dismisses them as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The follower makes two claw attacks and use his breath weapon, it can replace a claw attack with a spell.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire.

action.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
entries: Zindar uses one of the following options:

action.name: Fire Breath
entries: The follower exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Weakening Breath
entries: Zindar exhales gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or have disadvantage on Strength-based attack rolls, Strength checks, and Strength saving throws for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.name: Tsoagoth

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Tsoagoth can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Tsoagoth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: Tsoagoth deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Spell-Resistant Carapace
entries: Tsoagoth has advantage on saving throws against spells, and any creature that makes a spell attack against Tsoagoth has disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Tsoagoth makes three attacks: one with its pincer, one with its tail, and one with its tentacle grasp.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 22}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and Tsoagoth. Tsoagoth can have up to 5 creatures {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d8 + 10}) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a creature, it is knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tentacle Grasp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 20 ft., one creature. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 26}). If the target doesn't escape by the end of its next turn, Tromokratis throws the target up to 60 feet in a straight line. The target lands {@condition prone} and takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 3d12 + 10}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by Tromokratis, that creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside Tromokratis, and it takes 42 ({@damage 12d6}) acid damage at the start of each of Tromokratis's turns. If Tromokratis takes 50 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, Tromokratis must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of Tromokratis. If Tromokratis dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Tromokratis moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Tail
entries: Tromokratis makes one tail attack.

legendary.name: Bite (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Tromokratis makes one bite attack.

mythicHeader: If Tromokratis's mythic trait is active, it can use the options below as legendary actions for 1 hour after using Hearts of the Kraken.

mythic.name: Rampage
entries: Tromokratis makes two attacks: one with its tail and one with its tentacle grasp.

mythic.name: Coral Growth (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Each creature within 10 feet of Tromokratis must make a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw, taking 13 ({@damage 3d8}) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Until the start of its next turn, Tromokratis and its hearts gain a +2 bonus to AC.

Most krakens roam the seas, shattering hulls and scattering fleets, but the kraken Tromokratis notoriously vents its wrath on coastal settlements. Whether it acts at the command of the god Thassa or to sate its own hunger, Tromokratis numbers among the most feared threats in the sea, having no fixed lair and wandering where it will. In recent memory, the massive menace rose from the waves to topple the Pyrgnos, Meletis's great repository of scholarly knowledge. Since that day, the polis keeps a watch specifically for Tromokratis.

entries.name: Tromokratis as a Mythic Encounter
entries: Tromokratis numbers among the most powerful creatures a group of adventurers might face. If you wish to make an encounter with the kraken truly legendary, Tromokratis might use its Hearts of the Kraken mythic trait. When this happens, it calls upon a reserve of strength just as it appears to be vanquished. After its hearts are exposed, Tromokratis can choose one of its mythic actions when it uses a legendary action.
Read or paraphrase the following text when Tromokratis uses its Hearts of the Kraken trait:

The titanic monster's carapace cracks, revealing a pulsing, red-purple heart buried amid heaps of blubber and muscle. Fissures run across the beast's ancient shell, revealing three other mighty, ichor-slick organs. The sea terror thrashes, channeling pain into fury.
Fighting Tromokratis as a mythic encounter is equivalent to taking on two CR 26 creatures in one encounter. Award a party 180,000 XP for defeating Tromokratis after it uses Hearts of the Kraken.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The moray makes two attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) piercing damage. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}), and the target is {@condition restrained} until this grapple ends.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The moray makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the moray, it takes 24 ({@damage 7d6}) cold damage and have its maximum Constitution reduced by 1 at the start of each of the moray's turns. If the swallowed creature's Constitution is reduced to  0 it dies. A moray can have only one creature swallowed at a time.

If the moray takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the moray must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the moray. If the moray dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Cold Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The moray exhales chill wind in a 60-foot cone.  Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, taking 82 ({@damage 15d10}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The octopus can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Freedom of Movement
entries: The octopus ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be {@condition restrained}. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition grappled}.

trait.name: Legendary Charge
entries: If the octopus don't use up all of its legendary actions on a round, it reduces the value required on its next recharge roll by 1 for each action unspent.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The octopus makes three tentacle attacks, each of which it can replace with a use of Fling or Pressurized Jet (if available).

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}. The octopus has eight tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Fling
entries: One Medium or smaller object held or creature {@condition grappled} by the octopus is thrown up to 40 feet in a choosen direction and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Pressurized Jet {@recharge 5}
entries: The octopus shoots pressurized water jet at a target it can see within 120 feet. The target must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 55 ({@damage 10d10}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Tentacle Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The octopus makes one tentacle attack.

legendary.name: Fling
entries: The kraken uses Fling.
